name: linode
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing linode cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`linode` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/linode/terraform-provider-linode).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing linode cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/linode/terraform-provider-linode)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-linode` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-linode/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,

configPath.description: The path to the Linode config file to use. (default `~/.config/linode`)

configProfile.description: The Linode config profile to use. (default `default`)

disableInternalCache.description: Disable the internal caching system that backs certain Linode API requests.

eventPollMs.description: The rate in milliseconds to poll for events.

lkeEventPollMs.description: The rate in milliseconds to poll for LKE events.

lkeNodeReadyPollMs.description: The rate in milliseconds to poll for an LKE node to be ready.

maxRetryDelayMs.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds before retrying a request.

minRetryDelayMs.description: Minimum delay in milliseconds before retrying a request.

objAccessKey.description: The access key to be used in linode.ObjectStorageBucket and linode_object_storage_object.

objBucketForceDelete.description: If true, when deleting a linode.ObjectStorageBucket any objects and versions will be force deleted.

objSecretKey.description: The secret key to be used in linode.ObjectStorageBucket and linode_object_storage_object.

objUseTempKeys.description:
If true, temporary object keys will be created implicitly at apply-time for the linode.ObjectStorageObject and
linode_object_sorage_bucket resource.

skipImplicitReboots.description: If true, Linode Instances will not be rebooted on config and interface changes.

skipInstanceDeletePoll.description: Skip waiting for a linode.Instance resource to finish deleting.

skipInstanceReadyPoll.description: Skip waiting for a linode.Instance resource to be running.

token.description: The token that allows you access to your Linode account

uaPrefix.description: An HTTP User-Agent Prefix to prepend in API requests.

url.description: The HTTP(S) API address of the Linode API to use.

duration.description: The maximum maintenance window time in hours.

frequency.description: Whether maintenance occurs on a weekly or monthly basis.

hourOfDay.description: The hour to begin maintenance based in UTC time.

weekOfMonth.description: The week of the month to perform monthly frequency updates. Required for monthly frequency updates.

create.description: Used when creating the instance image (until the instance is available)

cpu.description: The percentage of CPU usage required to trigger an alert. If the average CPU usage over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0, the alert is disabled.

io.description: The amount of disk IO operation per second required to trigger an alert. If the average disk IO over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If set to 0, this alert is disabled.

networkIn.description: The amount of incoming traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average incoming traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

networkOut.description: The amount of outbound traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average outbound traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

transferQuota.description: The percentage of network transfer that may be used before an alert is triggered. When this value is exceeded, we'll alert you. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

available.description: Whether this Backup is available for restoration.

enabled.description: If this Linode has the Backup service enabled.

day.description: The day of the week that your Linode's weekly Backup is taken. If not set manually, a day will be chosen for you. Backups are taken every day, but backups taken on this day are preferred when selecting backups to retain for a longer period.  If not set manually, then when backups are initially enabled, this may come back as "Scheduling" until the day is automatically selected.

window.description: The window ('W0'-'W22') in which your backups will be taken, in UTC. A backups window is a two-hour span of time in which the backup may occur. For example, 'W10' indicates that your backups should be taken between 10:00 and 12:00. If you do not choose a backup window, one will be selected for you automatically.  If not set manually, when backups are initially enabled this may come back as Scheduling until the window is automatically selected.

devtmpfsAutomount.description: Populates the /dev directory early during boot without udev. Defaults to false.

distro.description: Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Distribution Helper setting.

modulesDep.description: Creates a modules dependency file for the Kernel you run.

network.description: Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Network Helper setting, used to automatically configure additional IP addresses assigned to this instance.

updatedbDisabled.description: Disables updatedb cron job to avoid disk thrashing.

active.description: Whether this interface is currently booted and active.

id.description: The ID of the Placement Group.

ipRanges.description: IPv4 CIDR VPC Subnet ranges that are routed to this Interface. IPv6 ranges are also available to select participants in the Beta program.

ipamAddress.description: This Network Interface’s private IP address in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. (e.g. `10.0.0.1/24`) This field is only allowed for interfaces with the `vlan` purpose.

ipv4.description: This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address upon creation, and may get a single private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to open a support ticket to get additional IPv4 addresses.

label.description: The name of the VLAN to join. This field is only allowed and required for interfaces with the `vlan` purpose.

primary.description:
Whether the interface is the primary interface that should have the default route for this Linode. This field is only allowed for interfaces with the `public` or `vpc` purpose.

* `ipv4` - (Optional) The IPv4 configuration of the VPC interface. This field is currently only allowed for interfaces with the `vpc` purpose.

The following computed attribute is available in a VPC interface:

subnetId.description: The name of the VPC Subnet to join. This field is only allowed and required for interfaces with the `vpc` purpose.

vpcId.description: The ID of VPC which this interface is attached to.

nat11.description: The public IP that will be used for the one-to-one NAT purpose. If this is `any`, the public IPv4 address assigned to this Linode is used on this interface and will be 1:1 NATted with the VPC IPv4 address.

vpc.description: The IP from the VPC subnet to use for this interface. A random address will be assigned if this is not specified in a VPC interface.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if 'image' is provided.

authorizedUsers.description: A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. Only accepted if 'image' is provided.

filesystem.description: The Disk filesystem can be one of: raw, swap, ext3, ext4, initrd (max 32mb)

id.description: The ID of the Placement Group.

image.description: An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/.

label.description: The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.

readOnly.description: If true, this Disk is read-only.

rootPass.description: The password that will be initialially assigned to the 'root' user account.

size.description: The size of the Disk in MB.

stackscriptData.description: An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed.

stackscriptId.description: The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

The following computed attribute is available in a VPC interface:

subnetId.description: The name of the VPC Subnet to join. This field is only allowed and required for interfaces with the `vpc` purpose.

nat11.description: The public IP that will be used for the one-to-one NAT purpose. If this is `any`, the public IPv4 address assigned to this Linode is used on this interface and will be 1:1 NATted with the VPC IPv4 address.

userData.description: The base64-encoded user-defined data exposed to this instance through the Linode Metadata service. Refer to the base64encode(...) function for information on encoding content for this field.

affinityType.description: The affinity policy enforced by the Placement Group.

id.description: The ID of the Placement Group.

isStrict.description: Whether the Placement Group enforces strict compliance.

label.description: The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.

disk.description: The amount of storage space, in GB. this Linode has access to. A typical Linode will divide this space between a primary disk with an image deployed to it, and a swap disk, usually 512 MB. This is the default configuration created when deploying a Linode with an image through POST /linode/instances.

memory.description: The amount of RAM, in MB, this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available RAM, but this can be configured in a Config profile.

transfer.description: The amount of network transfer this Linode is allotted each month.

vcpus.description: The number of vcpus this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available vcpus, but this can be configured in a Config Profile.

acl.description: Defines the ACL configuration for an LKE cluster's control plane.

highAvailability.description:
Defines whether High Availability is enabled for the cluster Control Plane. This is an **irreversible** change.

* `acl` - (Optional) Defines the ACL configuration for an LKE cluster's control plane. **NOTE: Control Plane ACLs may not currently be available to  all users.**

addresses.description: A list of ip addresses to allow.

enabled.description:
Defines default policy. A value of true results in a default policy of DENY. A value of false results in default policy of ALLOW, and has the same effect as delete the ACL configuration.

* `addresses` - (Optional) A list of ip addresses to allow.

ipv4s.description: A set of individual ipv4 addresses or CIDRs to ALLOW.

ipv6s.description: A set of individual ipv6 addresses or CIDRs to ALLOW.

autoscaler.description: When specified, the number of nodes autoscales within the defined minimum and maximum values.

count.description:
The number of nodes in the Node Pool. If undefined with an autoscaler the initial node count will equal the autoscaler minimum.

* `autoscaler` - (Optional) If defined, an autoscaler will be enabled with the given configuration.

id.description: The ID of the node.

nodes.description: The nodes in the node pool.

type.description: A Linode Type for all of the nodes in the Node Pool. See all node types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

max.description: The maximum number of nodes to autoscale to.

min.description: The minimum number of nodes to autoscale to.

hasUserData.description: Whether this Instance was created with user-data.

id.description: The ID of the disk in the Linode API.

image.description: An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with `private/`. See [images](https://api.linode.com/v4/images) for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are `linode/debian12`, `linode/fedora39`, `linode/ubuntu22.04`, `linode/arch`, and `private/12345`. See all images [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/images) (Requires a personal access token; docs [here](https://developers.linode.com/api/v4/images)). *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `image` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

ipAddress.description: A string containing the Linode's public IP address.

ipv4s.description: This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address upon creation, and may get a single private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to open a support ticket to get additional IPv4 addresses.

ipv6.description: This Linode's IPv6 SLAAC addresses. This address is specific to a Linode, and may not be shared.  The prefix (`/64`) is included in this attribute.

label.description: The name of the VLAN to join. This field is only allowed and required for interfaces with the `vlan` purpose.

privateIpAddress.description: This Linode's Private IPv4 Address, if enabled.  The regional private IP address range, 192.168.128.0/17, is shared by all Linode Instances in a region.

region.description: This is the location where the Linode is deployed. Examples are `"us-east"`, `"us-west"`, `"ap-south"`, etc. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions).

status.description: The status of the instance, indicating the current readiness state. (`running`, `offline`, ...)

swapSize.description: When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are case-insensitive and are for organizational purposes only.

type.description: The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are `"g6-nanode-1"`, `"g6-standard-2"`, `"g6-highmem-16"`, `"g6-dedicated-16"`, etc. See all types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

watchdogEnabled.description: The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

cpu.description: The percentage of CPU usage required to trigger an alert. If the average CPU usage over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0, the alert is disabled.

io.description: The amount of disk IO operation per second required to trigger an alert. If the average disk IO over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If set to 0, this alert is disabled.

networkIn.description: The amount of incoming traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average incoming traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

networkOut.description: The amount of outbound traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average outbound traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

transferQuota.description: The percentage of network transfer that may be used before an alert is triggered. When this value is exceeded, we'll alert you. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

available.description: Whether this Backup is available for restoration.

enabled.description: If this Linode has the Backup service enabled.

day.description: The day of the week that your Linode's weekly Backup is taken. If not set manually, a day will be chosen for you. Backups are taken every day, but backups taken on this day are preferred when selecting backups to retain for a longer period.  If not set manually, then when backups are initially enabled, this may come back as "Scheduling" until the day is automatically selected.

window.description: The window ('W0'-'W22') in which your backups will be taken, in UTC. A backups window is a two-hour span of time in which the backup may occur. For example, 'W10' indicates that your backups should be taken between 10:00 and 12:00. If you do not choose a backup window, one will be selected for you automatically.  If not set manually, when backups are initially enabled this may come back as Scheduling until the window is automatically selected.

devices.description: A list of `disk` or `volume` attachments for this `config`.  If the `boot_config_label` omits a `devices` block, the Linode will not be booted.

helpers.description: Helpers enabled when booting to this Linode Config.

id.description: The ID of the disk in the Linode API.

interfaces.description: An array of Network Interfaces for this Linode’s Configuration Profile.

kernel.description: A Kernel ID to boot a Linode with. Default is based on image choice. Examples are `linode/latest-64bit`, `linode/grub2`, `linode/direct-disk`, etc. See all kernels [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/kernels). Note that this is a paginated API endpoint ([docs](https://developers.linode.com/api/v4/linode-kernels)).

memoryLimit.description: Defaults to the total RAM of the Linode

runLevel.description: Defines the state of your Linode after booting.

The device can be either a Disk or a Volume identified by `disk_label` or `volume_id`. Only one disk identifier is permitted per slot. Devices mapped from `sde` through `sdh` are unavailable in `"fullvirt"` `virt_mode`.

vpc.description: The IP from the VPC subnet to use for this interface. A random address will be assigned if this is not specified in a VPC interface.

filesystem.description: The Disk filesystem can be one of: `"raw"`, `"swap"`, `"ext3"`, `"ext4"`, or `"initrd"` which has a max size of 32mb and can be used in the config `initrd` (not currently supported in this provider).

disk.description: The amount of storage space, in GB. this Linode has access to. A typical Linode will divide this space between a primary disk with an image deployed to it, and a swap disk, usually 512 MB. This is the default configuration created when deploying a Linode with an image through POST /linode/instances.

memory.description: The amount of RAM, in MB, this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available RAM, but this can be configured in a Config profile.

transfer.description: The amount of network transfer this Linode is allotted each month.

vcpus.description: The number of vcpus this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available vcpus, but this can be configured in a Config Profile.

algorithm.description: What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends (`roundrobin`, `leastconn`, `source`)

check.description: The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down. If none no check is performed. connection requires only a connection to the backend to succeed. http and http_body rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that the response returned matches what is expected. (`none`, `connection`, `http`, `http_body`)

checkAttempts.description: How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down. (1-30)

checkBody.description: This value must be present in the response body of the check in order for it to pass. If this value is not present in the response body of a check request, the backend is considered to be down

checkInterval.description: How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

checkPassive.description: If true, any response from this backend with a 5xx status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

checkPath.description: The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

checkTimeout.description: How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed. (1-30)

cipherSuite.description: What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer. `legacy` is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary. (`recommended`, `legacy`)

id.description: The config's ID.

nodeStatuses.description: A structure containing information about the health of the backends for this port. This information is updated periodically as checks are performed against backends.

nodebalancerId.description:
The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

port.description: The TCP port this Config is for.

protocol.description: The protocol this port is configured to serve. If this is set to https you must include an ssl_cert and an ssl_key. (`http`, `https`, `tcp`) (Defaults to `http`)

proxyProtocol.description: The version of ProxyProtocol to use for the underlying NodeBalancer. This requires protocol to be `tcp`. (`none`, `v1`, and `v2`) (Defaults to `none`)

sslCommonname.description: The read-only common name automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

sslFingerprint.description: The read-only fingerprint automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

stickiness.description: Controls how session stickiness is handled on this port. (`none`, `table`, `http_cookie`)

up.description: The number of backends considered to be 'UP' and healthy, and that are serving requests.

axfrIps.description: The list of IPs that may perform a zone transfer for this Domain. This is potentially dangerous, and should be set to an empty list unless you intend to use it.

description.description: A description for this Domain. This is for display purposes only.

domain.description: The domain this Domain represents. These must be unique in our system; you cannot have two Domains representing the same domain.

expireSec.description: The amount of time in seconds that may pass before this Domain is no longer authoritative. Valid values are 0, 30, 120, 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

group.description: The group this Domain belongs to. This is for display purposes only.

masterIps.description:
The IP addresses representing the master DNS for this Domain.

- - -

refreshSec.description: The amount of time in seconds before this Domain should be refreshed. Valid values are 0, 30, 120, 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

retrySec.description: The interval, in seconds, at which a failed refresh should be retried. Valid values are 0, 30, 120, 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

soaEmail.description: Start of Authority email address. This is required for master Domains.

status.description: Used to control whether this Domain is currently being rendered (defaults to "active").

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are case-insensitive and are for organizational purposes only.

ttlSec.description: 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. Valid values are 0, 30, 120, 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

type.description: If this Domain represents the authoritative source of information for the domain it describes, or if it is a read-only copy of a master (also called a slave).

domainId.description: The ID of the Domain to access.  *Changing `domain_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record.*.

name.description: The name of this Record. Setting this is invalid for `SRV` records as it is generated by the API. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the subdomain being associated with an IP address.

port.description: The port this Record points to.

priority.description: The priority of the target host. Lower values are preferred.

protocol.description: The protocol this Record's service communicates with. Only valid for SRV records.

recordType.description: The type of Record this is in the DNS system. For example, A records associate a domain name with an IPv4 address, and AAAA records associate a domain name with an IPv6 address. See all supported record types [here](https://www.linode.com/docs/api/domains/#domain-record-create__request-body-schema). *Changing `record_type` forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record.*.

service.description: The service this Record identified. Only valid for SRV records.

tag.description: The tag portion of a CAA record. It is invalid to set this on other record types.

target.description:
The target for this Record. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the address the named Domain should resolve to.

- - -

ttlSec.description: 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. Valid values are 30, 120, 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

weight.description: The relative weight of this Record. Higher values are preferred.

created.description: When this firewall was created

devices.description: The devices associated with this firewall.

disabled.description:
If `true`, the Firewall's rules are not enforced (defaults to `false`).

* `inbound` - (Optional) A firewall rule that specifies what inbound network traffic is allowed.

inboundPolicy.description:
The default behavior for inbound traffic. This setting can be overridden by updating the inbound.action property of the Firewall Rule. (`ACCEPT`, `DROP`)

* `outbound` - (Optional) A firewall rule that specifies what outbound network traffic is allowed.

inbounds.description: A firewall rule that specifies what inbound network traffic is allowed.

label.description: This Firewall's unique label.

linodes.description: A list of IDs of Linodes this Firewall should govern network traffic for.

- - -

The following arguments apply to creating an image from an existing Linode Instance:

diskId.description: The ID of the Linode Disk that this Image will be created from.

expiry.description: Only Images created automatically (from a deleted Linode; type=automatic) will expire.

fileHash.description: The MD5 hash of the file to be uploaded. This is used to trigger file updates.

filePath.description: The path of the image file to be uploaded.

isPublic.description: True if the Image is public.

label.description: A short description of the Image. Labels cannot contain special characters.

linodeId.description:
The ID of the Linode that this Image will be created from.

- - -

> **NOTICE:** Uploading images is currently in beta. Ensure `LINODE_API_VERSION` is set to `v4beta` in order to use this functionality.

The following arguments apply to uploading an image:

region.description: The region of the image. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions).

size.description: The minimum size this Image needs to deploy. Size is in MB.

status.description: The current status of this Image.

type.description: How the Image was created. 'Manual' Images can be created at any time. 'Automatic' images are created automatically from a deleted Linode.

vendor.description: The upstream distribution vendor. Nil for private Images.

The following arguments apply to uploading an image:

region.description: The region of the image. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions).

size.description: The minimum size this Image needs to deploy. Size is in MB.

status.description: The current status of this Image.

type.description: How the Image was created. 'Manual' Images can be created at any time. 'Automatic' images are created automatically from a deleted Linode.

vendor.description: The upstream distribution vendor. Nil for private Images.

alerts.description: Configuration options for alert triggers on this Linode.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if 'image' is provided.

authorizedUsers.description:
A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's
`~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. Only accepted if 'image' is provided.

backupId.description:
A Backup ID from another Linode's available backups. Your User must have read_write access to that Linode, the Backup
must have a status of successful, and the Linode must be deployed to the same region as the Backup. See
/linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups for a Linode's available backups. This field and the image field are mutually
exclusive.

backups.description: Information about this Linode's backups status.

backupsEnabled.description: If this field is set to true, the created Linode will automatically be enrolled in the Linode Backup service. This will incur an additional charge. The cost for the Backup service is dependent on the Type of Linode deployed.

bootConfigLabel.description: The Label of the Instance Config that should be used to boot the Linode instance.

booted.description: If true, then the instance is kept or converted into in a running state. If false, the instance will be shutdown. If unspecified, the Linode's power status will not be managed by the Provider.

configs.description: Configuration profiles define the VM settings and boot behavior of the Linode Instance.
configs.deprecationMessage: The embedded config is deprecated and scheduled to be removed in the next major version.Please consider migrating it  to linode_instance_config resource.

disks.deprecationMessage: The embedded disk block in linode.Instance resource is deprecated and scheduled to be removed in the next major version. Please consider migrating it to be the linode.InstanceDisk resource.

firewallId.description: The ID of the Firewall to attach to the instance upon creation. *Changing `firewall_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

group.description: A deprecated property denoting a group label for this Linode. We recommend using the `tags` attribute instead.
group.deprecationMessage: Group label is deprecated. We recommend using tags instead.

hasUserData.description: Whether this Instance was created with user-data.

hostUuid.description: The Linode’s host machine, as a UUID.

image.description:
An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/.
See /images for more information on the Images available for you to use.

interfaces.description:
An array of Network Interfaces for this Linode to be created with. If an explicit config or disk is defined, interfaces
must be declared in the config block.

ipAddress.description: A string containing the Linode's public IP address.

ipv4s.description: This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address upon creation, and may get a single private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to open a support ticket to get additional IPv4 addresses.

ipv6.description: This Linode's IPv6 SLAAC addresses. This address is specific to a Linode, and may not be shared.  The prefix (`/64`) is included in this attribute.

label.description: The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.

metadatas.description: Various fields related to the Linode Metadata service.

migrationType.description:
The type of migration to use when updating the type or region of a Linode. (`cold`, `warm`; default `cold`)

* `interface` - (Optional) A list of network interfaces to be assigned to the Linode on creation. If an explicit config or disk is defined, interfaces must be declared in the `config` block.

placementGroup.description: Information about the Placement Group this Linode is assigned to. NOTE: Placement Groups may not currently be available to all users.

placementGroupExternallyManaged.description: If true, changes to the Linode's assigned Placement Group will be ignored. This is necessary when using this resource in conjunction with the linode.PlacementGroupAssignment resource.

privateIp.description: If true, the created Linode will have private networking enabled, allowing use of the 192.168.128.0/17 network within the Linode's region. It can be enabled on an existing Linode but it can't be disabled.

privateIpAddress.description: This Linode's Private IPv4 Address, if enabled.  The regional private IP address range, 192.168.128.0/17, is shared by all Linode Instances in a region.

region.description: This is the location where the Linode is deployed. Examples are `"us-east"`, `"us-west"`, `"ap-south"`, etc. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions). *Changing `region` will trigger a migration of this Linode. Migration operations are typically long-running operations, so the update timeout should be adjusted accordingly.*.

resizeDisk.description:
If true, changes in Linode type will attempt to upsize or downsize implicitly created disks. This must be false if explicit disks are defined. *This is an irreversible action as Linode disks cannot be automatically downsized.*

* `alerts.0.cpu` - (Optional) The percentage of CPU usage required to trigger an alert. If the average CPU usage over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0, the alert is disabled.

* `alerts.0.network_in` - (Optional) The amount of incoming traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average incoming traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

* `alerts.0.network_out` - (Optional) The amount of outbound traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average outbound traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

* `alerts.0.transfer_quota` - (Optional) The percentage of network transfer that may be used before an alert is triggered. When this value is exceeded, we'll alert you. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

* `alerts.0.io` - (Optional) The amount of disk IO operation per second required to trigger an alert. If the average disk IO over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If set to 0, this alert is disabled.

rootPass.description: The password that will be initially assigned to the 'root' user account.

sharedIpv4s.description:
A set of IPv4 addresses to be shared with the Instance. These IP addresses can be both private and public, but must be in the same region as the instance.

* `metadata.0.user_data` - (Optional) The base64-encoded user-defined data exposed to this instance through the Linode Metadata service. Refer to the base64encode(...) function for information on encoding content for this field.

* `placement_group.0.id` - (Optional) The ID of the Placement Group to assign this Linode to.

specs.description: Information about the resources available to this Linode.

stackscriptData.description:
An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only
accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed.

stackscriptId.description:
The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image
that is compatible with this StackScript.

status.description: The status of the instance, indicating the current readiness state. (`running`, `offline`, ...)

swapSize.description:
When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This
is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are case-insensitive and are for organizational purposes only.

type.description:
The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are `"g6-nanode-1"`, `"g6-standard-2"`, `"g6-highmem-16"`, `"g6-dedicated-16"`, etc. See all types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

- - -

watchdogEnabled.description: The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

swapSize.description:
When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This
is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are case-insensitive and are for organizational purposes only.

type.description:
The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are `"g6-nanode-1"`, `"g6-standard-2"`, `"g6-highmem-16"`, `"g6-dedicated-16"`, etc. See all types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

- - -

watchdogEnabled.description: The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

authorizedUsers.description: A list of usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the root user's ~/.ssh/authorized_keys file. (Requires `image`)

label.description: The Disk's label for display purposes only.

linodeId.description: The ID of the Linode to create this Disk under.

rootPass.description: The root user’s password on a newly-created Linode Disk when deploying from an Image. (Requires `image`)

size.description:
The size of the Disk in MB. **NOTE:** Resizing a disk will trigger a Linode reboot.

- - -

LKE Clusters can be imported using the `id`, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import linode:index/lkeCluster:LkeCluster my_cluster 12345
```

* `autoscaler` - (Optional) If defined, an autoscaler will be enabled with the given configuration.

algorithm.description: What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends. (`roundrobin`, `leastconn`, `source`)

check.description: The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down. If none no check is performed. connection requires only a connection to the backend to succeed. http and http_body rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that the response returned matches what is expected. (`none`, `connection`, `http`, `http_body`)

checkAttempts.description: How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down. (1-30)

checkBody.description:
This value must be present in the response body of the check in order for it to pass. If this value is not present in
the response body of a check request, the backend is considered to be down

checkInterval.description: How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

checkPassive.description: If true, any response from this backend with a 5xx status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

checkPath.description: The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

checkTimeout.description: How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed. (1-30)

cipherSuite.description: What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer. `legacy` is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary.

nodeStatuses.description:

periodically as checks are performed against backends.

nodebalancerId.description: The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

port.description: The TCP port this Config is for. These values must be unique across configs on a single NodeBalancer (you can't have two configs for port 80, for example). While some ports imply some protocols, no enforcement is done and you may configure your NodeBalancer however is useful to you. For example, while port 443 is generally used for HTTPS, you do not need SSL configured to have a NodeBalancer listening on port 443. (Defaults to 80)

protocol.description: The protocol this port is configured to serve. If this is set to https you must include an ssl_cert and an ssl_key. (`http`, `https`, `tcp`) (Defaults to `http`)

proxyProtocol.description: The version of ProxyProtocol to use for the underlying NodeBalancer. This requires protocol to be `tcp`. (`none`, `v1`, `v2`) (Defaults to `none`)

sslCert.description: The certificate this port is serving. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as `<REDACTED>`. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

sslCommonname.description: The read-only common name automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

sslFingerprint.description: The read-only fingerprint automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

sslKey.description: The private key corresponding to this port's certificate. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as `<REDACTED>`. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

linode:index/nodeBalancerNode:NodeBalanc.description:
Provides a Linode NodeBalancer Node resource.  This can be used to create, modify, and delete Linodes NodeBalancer Nodes.
For more information, see [Getting Started with NodeBalancers](https://www.linode.com/docs/platform/nodebalancer/getting-started-with-nodebalancers/) and the [Linode APIv4 docs](https://developers.linode.com/api/v4#operation/createNodeBalancerNode).

## Import

NodeBalancer Nodes can be imported using the NodeBalancer `nodebalancer_id` followed by the NodeBalancer Config `config_id` followed by the NodeBalancer Node `id`, separated by a comma, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import linode:index/nodeBalancerNode:NodeBalancerNode https-foobar-1 1234567,7654321,9999999
```

address.description:
The private IP Address where this backend can be reached. This must be a private IP address.

- - -

configId.description: The ID of the NodeBalancerConfig to access.

label.description: The label of the Linode NodeBalancer Node. This is for display purposes only.

mode.description: The mode this NodeBalancer should use when sending traffic to this backend. If set to `accept` this backend is accepting traffic. If set to `reject` this backend will not receive traffic. If set to `drain` this backend will not receive new traffic, but connections already pinned to it will continue to be routed to it. (`accept`, `reject`, `drain`, `backup`)

nodebalancerId.description: The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

status.description: The current status of this node, based on the configured checks of its NodeBalancer Config. (`unknown`, `UP`, `DOWN`).

weight.description: Used when picking a backend to serve a request and is not pinned to a single backend yet. Nodes with a higher weight will receive more traffic. (1-255).

For larger objects, use `source` to stream the content from a disk file.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getNodeBalancerConfig.

id.description: The config's ID.

nodebalancerId.description: The ID of the NodeBalancer that contains the config.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getNodeBalancerConfig.

algorithm.description: What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends (`roundrobin`, `leastconn`, `source`)

check.description: The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down. If none no check is performed. connection requires only a connection to the backend to succeed. http and http_body rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that the response returned matches what is expected. (`none`, `connection`, `http`, `http_body`)

checkAttempts.description: How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down. (1-30)

checkInterval.description: How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

checkPassive.description: If true, any response from this backend with a 5xx status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

checkPath.description: The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

checkTimeout.description: How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed. (1-30)

cipherSuite.description: What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer. `legacy` is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary. (`recommended`, `legacy`)

port.description: The TCP port this Config is for.

protocol.description: The protocol this port is configured to serve. If this is set to https you must include an ssl_cert and an ssl_key. (`http`, `https`, `tcp`) (Defaults to `http`)

proxyProtocol.description: The version of ProxyProtocol to use for the underlying NodeBalancer. This requires protocol to be `tcp`. (`none`, `v1`, and `v2`) (Defaults to `none`)

sslCommonname.description: The read-only common name automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

sslFingerprint.description: The read-only fingerprint automatically derived from the SSL certificate assigned to this NodeBalancerConfig. Please refer to this field to verify that the appropriate certificate is assigned to your NodeBalancerConfig.

stickiness.description: Controls how session stickiness is handled on this port. (`none`, `table`, `http_cookie`)

address.description: The private IP Address where this backend can be reached.

label.description: The label of the Linode NodeBalancer Node. This is for display purposes only.

mode.description: The mode this NodeBalancer should use when sending traffic to this backend. If set to `accept` this backend is accepting traffic. If set to `reject` this backend will not receive traffic. If set to `drain` this backend will not receive new traffic, but connections already pinned to it will continue to be routed to it. (`accept`, `reject`, `drain`, `backup`)

status.description: The current status of this node, based on the configured checks of its NodeBalancer Config. (`unknown`, `UP`, `DOWN`).

weight.description: Used when picking a backend to serve a request and is not pinned to a single backend yet. Nodes with a higher weight will receive more traffic. (1-255).

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getStackScript.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the StackScript to query.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getStackScript.

created.description: The date this StackScript was created.

deploymentsActive.description: Count of currently active, deployed Linodes created from this StackScript.

deploymentsTotal.description: The total number of times this StackScript has been deployed.

description.description: A description for the StackScript.

images.description: A set of Image IDs representing the Images that this StackScript is compatible for deploying with. `any/all` indicates that all available image distributions, including private images, are accepted.

isPublic.description: This determines whether other users can use your StackScript. Once a StackScript is made public, it cannot be made private.

label.description: A human-readable label for the field that will serve as the input prompt for entering the value during deployment.

revNote.description: This field allows you to add notes for the set of revisions made to this StackScript.

script.description: The script to execute when provisioning a new Linode with this StackScript.

updated.description: The date this StackScript was updated.

userDefinedFields.description: This is a list of fields defined with a special syntax inside this StackScript that allow for supplying customized parameters during deployment.

userGravatarId.description: The Gravatar ID for the User who created the StackScript.

username.description: The User who created the StackScript.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getStackScripts.

latest.description:
If true, only the latest StackScript will be returned. StackScripts without a valid `created` field are not included in the result.

* `filter` - (Optional) A set of filters used to select Linode StackScripts that meet certain requirements.

order.description: The order in which results should be returned. (`asc`, `desc`; default `asc`)

orderBy.description: The attribute to order the results by. See the Filterable Fields section for a list of valid fields.

email.description: The email address for this User, for account management communications, and may be used for other communications as configured.

id.description: The ID of entity this grant applies to.

passwordCreated.description: The date and time when this User’s current password was created. User passwords are first created during the Account sign-up process, and updated using the Reset Password webpage. null if this User has not created a password yet.

restricted.description: If true, this User must be granted access to perform actions or access entities on this Account.

sshKeys.description: A list of SSH Key labels added by this User. These are the keys that will be deployed if this User is included in the authorized_users field of a create Linode, rebuild Linode, or create Disk request.

tfaEnabled.description: A boolean value indicating if the User has Two Factor Authentication (TFA) enabled.

verifiedPhoneNumber.description: The phone number verified for this User Profile with the Phone Number Verify command. null if this User Profile has no verified phone number.

created.description: When this Volume was created.

filesystemPath.description: The full filesystem path for the Volume based on the Volume's label. Path is /dev/disk/by-id/scsi-0LinodeVolume + Volume label.

id.description: The unique ID of this Volume.

label.description: This Volume's label is for display purposes only.

linodeId.description: If a Volume is attached to a specific Linode, the ID of that Linode will be displayed here. If the Volume is unattached, this value will be null.

region.description: The datacenter in which this Volume is located. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions).

status.description: The current status of the Volume. (`creating`, `active`, `resizing`, `contact_support`)

tags.description: An array of tags applied to this object. Tags are case-insensitive and are for organizational purposes only.

updated.description: When this Volume was last updated.
